summary: This document is an email chain regarding IP address submittals for a Nice Vision system, likely related to surveillance or security infrastructure. The correspondence involves Justin Houston of Signet Technologies and appears to be directed to or from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) in New York, suggesting it may relate to facility systems.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.context: Program Manager for FBOP Contracts at Signet Technologies, involved in submitting IP addresses for a Nice Vision system, likely in a correctional facility context.

locations: MCC-New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007-1704
Signet Technologies, 12300 Kiln Ct Suite E, Beltsville, MD 20705
keyFacts: The email discusses IP address configurations for a 'Nice Vision system', which is typically a video surveillance/security system.
The correspondence is addressed to the US Department of Justice MCC-New York, indicating it relates to systems at the Metropolitan Correctional Center.
Justin Houston of Signet Technologies is coordinating IP submittals needed to program an AMS server.
The document lists multiple IP addresses and ports assigned to the Nice Vision system components (DVRs, viewing stations, decoders).
The email chain dates from November 2018, during the period when Jeffrey Epstein was incarcerated at MCC New York.
